io.permazen.schema

Class SchemaModel

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.permazen.util.AbstractXMLStreaming
      • io.permazen.schema.SchemaModel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    DiffGenerating<SchemaModel>, Cloneable

    public class SchemaModel
extends AbstractXMLStreaming
implements DiffGenerating<SchemaModel>
    Models one Permazen Database schema version.

      • fromXML

        public static SchemaModel fromXML(InputStream input)
                           throws IOException
        Deserialize an instance from the given XML input and validate it.
        Parameters:
        input - XML input
        Returns:
        deserialized schema model
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs
        InvalidSchemaException - if the XML input or decoded SchemaModel is invalid
        IllegalArgumentException - if input is null

      • validate

        public void validate()
        Validate this instance.

        This performs some basic structural validation. Full validation is not possible without a Database instance (for example, we don't know whether or not a custom SimpleSchemaField type name is registered with the associated FieldTypeRegistry).

        Note that after this instance has been locked down, repeated invocations of this method will be very fast, just returning the cached previous result.

        Throws:
        InvalidSchemaException - if this instance is detected to be invalid

      • isCompatibleWith

        public boolean isCompatibleWith(SchemaModel that)
        Determine whether this instance is compatible with the given instance for use with the core API and the same version number.

        Two instances are "same version" compatible if and only if they can be used to successfully open a transaction against the same Database using the same schema version.

        Such compatibility implies the instances are mostly identical, with these notable exceptions:

        • Object and field names (the core API identifies types and fields using only storage ID's)
        • Attributes affecting behavior but not structure, such as delete cascades

        To determine whether two instances are truly identical, use equals().

        Parameters:
        that - other schema model
        Returns:
        true if this and that are "same version" compatible
        Throws:
        InvalidSchemaException - if either this or that instance is invalid
        IllegalArgumentException - if that is null

      • compatibilityHash

        public long compatibilityHash()
        Generate a "same version" compatibility hash value.

        For any two instances, if they are "same version" compatible then the returned value will be the same; if they are different, the returned value is very likely to be different.

        Returns:
        "same version" compatibility hash value

      • autogenerateVersion

        public int autogenerateVersion()
        Auto-generate a random schema version based on this instance's "same version" compatibility hash value.
        Returns:
        schema version number, always greater than zero

        public void lockDown()
        Lock down this instance.
